metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1547 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows Backup Engine improperly handles memory.To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would first have to gain execution on the victim system, aka 'Windows Backup Engine Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2020-1535, CVE-2020-1536, CVE-2020-1539, CVE-2020-1540, CVE-2020-1541, CVE-2020-1542, CVE-2020-1543, CVE-2020-1544, CVE-2020-1545, CVE-2020-1546, CVE-2020-1551.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-client - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-router - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-server - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.19-0ubuntu4').
